pkgmetadata.longdescription: # Printcleaner: the simplest way to remove print statements from your Python code![GitHub](https://img.shields.io/github/license/larsvonschaff/printcleaner)![PyPI](https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/printcleaner)### Is your Python code littered with random print statements from debugging or simply exploring?Printcleaner is a simple CLI that removes all of them with one command. All you need to do is:```pip install printcleaner ``````clean < name of your file or directory > ```Done. Don't worry: comments, formatting, whitespace and everything else in your code will be preserved.
